attributes.action: Change the Voting System from FPTP to AMS (Additional Member System)
attributes.additional_details: The Additional Member System is a combination – a hybrid – of the First-Past-The-Post system and Party List voting. The purpose is to retain the best features of First-Past-The-Post while adding proportionality between parties through party list voting to ensure a fairer result.
attributes.background: Britain has used the First Past The Post system for too long! The system is unfair and does not represent the voice of the British public
